com.example.cshare.webservices

Interface AuthenticationAPI


  • public interface AuthenticationAPI
    Interface that defines the authentication-related API endpoints.

    Provides endpoints for registering, logging in or out, changing and resetting password or deleting account information.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Clara Gros, Babacar Toure

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      retrofit2.Call<EmptyAuthResponse> changePassword(java.lang.String token, User changePasswordForm) 
      retrofit2.Call<RegistrationResponse> createUserWithoutPicture(User registerForm) 
      retrofit2.Call<RegistrationResponse> createUserWithPicture(okhttp3.MultipartBody.Part profilePictureBody, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String roomNumber, java.lang.String campus, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password1, java.lang.String password2) 
      retrofit2.Call<EmptyAuthResponse> delete(java.lang.String token, int userID) 
      retrofit2.Call<User> getProfileInfo(java.lang.String token)
      Define the authentication-related API endpoints.
      retrofit2.Call<LoginResponse> login(User loginForm) 
      retrofit2.Call<EmptyAuthResponse> logout(java.lang.String token)

retrofit2.Call<RegistrationResponse> createUserWithPicture(@Part

retrofit2.Call<LoginResponse> login(@Body
                                                                    User loginForm)

      • logout

        @POST(value="rest-auth/logout/")
retrofit2.Call<EmptyAuthResponse> logout(@Header(value="Authorization")
                                                                          java.lang.String token)

      • changePassword

        @POST(value="rest-auth/password/change/")
retrofit2.Call<EmptyAuthResponse> changePassword(@Header(value="Authorization")
                                                                                           java.lang.String token,
                                                                                           @Body
                                                                                           User changePasswordForm)

      • resetPassword

        @FormUrlEncoded
 @POST(value="rest-auth/password/reset/")
retrofit2.Call<EmptyAuthResponse> resetPassword(@Body
                                                                                                          User resetPasswordForm)

      • delete

        @DELETE(value="user/{id}/")
retrofit2.Call<EmptyAuthResponse> delete(@Header(value="Authorization")
                                                                     java.lang.String token,
                                                                     @Path(value="id")
                                                                     int userID)
